text: Michael Yale Scudder Jr. (born January 9, 1971) is a United States Circuit Judge of the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit. Previously, he was a partner in the Chicago office of Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom. == Biography == In 1989, Scudder graduated from Bishop Dwenger High School in Fort Wayne, Indiana.http://journalgazette.net/news/local/20180213/dwenger-grad-tapped- for-7th-circuit Scudder received his Bachelor of Business Administration from Saint Joseph's College as co-valedictorian, and his Juris Doctor in 1998 magna cum laude from the Northwestern University Pritzker School of Law, where he was inducted into the Order of the Coif. Scudder worked as an auditor for Ernst and Young before attending law school and is a Certified Public Accountant. Before entering private practice, Scudder served as a law clerk to Judge Paul V. Niemeyer of the United States Court of Appeals for the Fourth Circuit and to Associate Justice Anthony Kennedy of the Supreme Court of the United States from 1999 to 2000. He then served as an attorney for two years at Jones Day in Cleveland, Ohio. Scudder later entered public service as an Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York and as Counsel to the Deputy Attorney General on the National Security team. From 2007 to 2009, he served in the White House Counsel's office and as the General Counsel of the National Security Council. He served as a partner of Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom in its Chicago office. He has taught at the Pritzker Law School since 2009 and since 2013 at the University of Chicago Law School."President Donald J. Trump Announces Eleventh Wave of Judicial Nominees" White House, February 12, 2018 == Federal judicial service == On February 12, 2018, President Trump announced his intent to nominate Scudder to an undetermined seat on the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit. On February 15, 2018, his nomination was sent to the Senate. President Trump nominated Scudder to the seat vacated by Judge Richard Posner, who retired on September 2, 2017.PN1647 — Michael Y. Scudder — The Judiciary, congress.gov On March 21, 2018, a hearing on his nomination was held before the Senate Judiciary Committee.United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary: Nominations for March 21, 2018 On April 19, 2018, his nomination was reported out of committee by a 21–0 vote.Results of Executive Business Meeting – April 19, 2018, Senate Judiciary Committee On May 14, 2018, his nomination was confirmed by a vote of 90–0. Scudder received his commission on May 21, 2018. == Civic activities == Scudder serves as vice chairman of the Board of Advisors of the Catholic Charities, Archdiocese of Chicago. == Personal life == On July 3, 1993, Scudder married Sarah Rose Schoenle in Allen County, Indiana. == See also == * List of law clerks of the Supreme Court of the United States == References == == External links == * * * Biography at Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom Category:1971 births Category:Living people Category:20th-century American lawyers Category:21st-century American lawyers Category:21st-century American judges Category:American accountants Category:Assistant United States Attorneys Category:George W.
